info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 7:26PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Brazoria and southeastern Harris Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 726 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Houston Ship Channel, or over Galena Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pasadena, eastern Pearland, Deer Park, South Houston, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Midtown Houston, Cloverleaf, Downtown Houston, Northside / Northline, Second Ward, Greater Heights, South Belt / Ellington, Neartown / Montrose, Greater Eastwood, Near Northside Houston, Greater Fifth Ward, Greater Hobby Area, Greater Third Ward and Fourth Ward. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
